title.div: The Education (European Institutions) and Student Support (Wales) Regulations 2013 / Rheoliadau Addysg (Sefydliadau Ewropeaidd) a Chymorth i Fyfyrwyr (Cymru) 2013

div.p: These Regulations provide for financial support for eligible students ordinarily resident in Wales undertaking postgraduate courses at the graduate school for international relations established by Johns Hopkins University at Bologna (known as the Bologna Center) and the College of Europe. The Regulations apply in respect of academic years beginning on or after 1 September 2013.

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn darparu ar gyfer cymorth ariannol i fyfyrwyr cymwys sy'n preswylio fel arfer yng Nghymru ac sy'n ymgymryd â chyrsiau ôl-raddedig yn yr ysgol i raddedigion mewn cysylltiadau rhyngwladol a sefydlwyd gan Brifysgol Johns Hopkins yn Bologna (a elwir yn Ganolfan Bologna) ac yng Ngholeg Ewrop. Mae'r Rheoliadau yn gymwys o ran y blynyddoedd academaidd sy'n dechrau ar 1 Medi 2013 neu ar ôl hynny.

entry.title: Registered Rents (Increase) Order (Northern Ireland) 2013
entry.summary: This Order increases the rents registered with the rent officer for Northern Ireland under Part IV of the Private Tenancies (Northern Ireland) Order 2006 during the period beginning on 2 April 2007 and ending on 7 April 2013 by 3.6 percent.

entry.title: The Budget (Scotland) Act 2012 Amendment Order 2013
entry.summary: This Order amends the Budget (Scotland) Act 2012 (“the Act”).

entry.title: The School Information (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2013
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the School Information (England) Regulations 2008 and come into force on 1st September 2013. They impose an additional requirement on maintained schools to publish specified details relating to the Year 7 literacy and numeracy catch-up premium grant on a website.

entry.title: The Education (Penalty Notices) (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2013
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Education (Penalty Notices) (England) Regulations 2007 (“the Principal Regulations”) to shorten the period in which the penalty notice must be paid to the local education authority.

entry.title: The Education (Pupil Registration) (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2013
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Education (Pupil Registration) (England) Regulations 2006 (“the 2006 Regulations”).

entry.title: The Council Tax (Additional Provisions for Discount Disregards) (Amendment) (England) Regulations 2013
entry.summary: The Council Tax (Additional Provisions for Discount Disregards) Regulations 1992 (“the 1992 Regulations”) prescribe requirements which must be fulfilled by care workers and various persons of other descriptions in order for them to be disregarded for the purposes of council tax discounts under section 11 of the Local Government Finance Act 1992 (“the 1992 Act”). Under section 11 of the 1992 Act council tax discounts apply to properties where there are two or more residents and each of them except one falls to be disregarded and where there are one or more residents and each of them falls to be disregarded.

entry.title: The Bank of England (Call Notice) (Benchmark Rate of Interest) Order 2013
entry.summary: Schedule 2 to the Bank of England Act 1998 (c. 11) makes provision concerning the maintenance by certain institutions of cash ratio deposits with the Bank of England (“the Bank”). The institutions covered by these arrangements are those defined as “deposit-takers” by section 17 of, and sub-paragraphs (1A) to (1C) of paragraph 1 of Schedule 2 to, that Act. The Bank is empowered by paragraph 3 of that Schedule to give such an institution a call notice specifying an amount it is expected to have on deposit with the Bank during a specified period. Under paragraph 6(3), the amount the Bank may require an institution to pay when eligible institutions are late in making deposits is an amount equal to interest for the period covered by the notice, at 4% over the benchmark rate.

entry.title: The Pensions (2012 Act) (Commencement No. 3) Order (Northern Ireland) 2013
entry.summary: This Order brings into operation section 22 of, and Schedule 4 to, the Pensions Act (Northern Ireland) 2012, in so far as they are not already in operation, on 27th March 2013. Those provisions relate to the postponement of compensation from the Pension Protection Fund.

entry.title: The Consular Fees (Amendment) Regulations 2013
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Consular Fees Regulations 1981 (“the 1981 Regulations”). The 1981 Regulations prescribe the manner in which all fees taken by persons authorised by the Secretary of State to exercise consular functions, or functions in the United Kingdom which correspond with consular functions, shall be levied, accounted for and applied, and may be remitted.

entry.title: The Civil Proceedings Fees (Amendment) Order 2013

ukm:Subject.Value: SENIOR COURTS OF ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: SENIOR COURTS OF ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: This Order amends the Civil Proceedings Fees Order 2008 (S.I. 2008/1053).

entry.title: The European Communities (Recognition of Professional Qualifications) (Amendment) Regulations 2013
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the European Communities (Recognition of Professional Qualifications) Regulations 2007 (“the 2007 Regulations”). The 2007 Regulations implement in part Council Directive 2005/36/EC on the recognition of professional qualifications (OJ No. L255, 30.09.2005 p 22) as amended by Council Directive 2006/100/EC (OJ No. L 363 of 20.12.2006 p.141).

entry.title: The Finance Act 2012, Schedule 22 (Reduction of Supplementary Charge for Certain Oil Fields) (Appointed Day) Order 2013
entry.summary: This Order appoints 1 April 2013 as the date upon which the amendments made by Schedule 22 to the Finance Act 2012 (c.14) (“Schedule 22”) comes into force. Paragraphs 14, 15 and 16(3) of Schedule 22 are excluded from the scope of this Order as they came into force on the day upon which the Finance Act 2012 was passed.

entry.title: The Guardian’s Allowance Up-rating (Northern Ireland) Order 2013

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Guardian’s Allowance Up-rating (Northern Ireland) Order 2013

entry.summary: This Order is made by the Treasury following a review of the general level of prices conducted under section 150 of the Social Security Administration Act 1992 (c. 5) in the tax year ending 5th April 2013.

entry.title: The Guardian’s Allowance Up-rating Order 2013
entry.summary: This Order is made by the Treasury following a review of the general level of prices conducted under section 150 of the Social Security Administration Act 1992 (c. 5) in the tax year ending 5th April 2013.

entry.title: The Tax Credits Up-rating, etc. Regulations 2013

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Tax Credits Up-rating, etc. Regulations 2013

entry.summary: Section 41 of the Tax Credits Act 2002 (c. 21) requires the Treasury, in each tax year, to—

entry.title: The Scotland Act 2012 (Consequential Provisions) Order 2013
entry.summary: The Order amends a number of enactments in consequence of sections 34 to 36 of the Scotland Act 2012 coming into force on 22nd April 2013. These sections create a new system of “compatibility issues”.

entry.title: The Localism Act 2011 (Commencement No. 2 and Transitional Provisions) Order 2013
entry.summary: Article 3 of this Order brings into force, in relation to England, sections 180 to 182 of the Localism Act 2011 (matters relating to the housing ombudsman) from the commencement date. The insertion of paragraph 7D into Schedule 2 to the Housing Act 1996 by section 180(1) of the Localism Act 2011 is not commenced.

entry.title: The Electoral Registration (Postponement of 2013 Annual Canvass) Order 2013

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Electoral Registration (Postponement of 2013 Annual Canvass) Order 2013

entry.summary: This Order postpones the annual canvass for 2013 to be conducted under section 10(1) of Representation of the People Act 1983, as part of the transitional arrangements for the implementation of individual electoral registration under the Electoral Registration and Administration Act 2013.

entry.title: The Enterprise Act 2002 (Part 8 Domestic Infringements) Order 2013

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Enterprise Act 2002 (Part 8 Domestic Infringements) Order 2013

entry.summary: Part 8 of the Enterprise Act 2002 enables persons and bodies which are general or designated enforcers to seek enforcement orders prohibiting domestic and Community infringements. Section 211(1) of the Act defines a domestic infringement as an act or omission done or made by a person in the course of a business which falls within section 211(2) and harms the collective interests of consumers in the United Kingdom.
